LiteGraph.name: LiteGraph
LiteGraph.description: The Global Scope. It contains all the registered node classes.

LGraph.name: LGraph
LGraph.description:
LGraph is the class that contain a full graph. We instantiate one and add nodes to it, and then we can run the execution loop.
supported callbacks:
		+ onNodeAdded: when a new node is added to the graph
		+ onNodeRemoved: when a node inside this graph is removed
		+ onNodeConnectionChange: some connection has changed in the graph (connected or disconnected)

params.name: o
params.description: data from previous serialization [optional]

LGraphNode.name: LGraphNode
LGraphNode.description: Base Class for all the node type classes

params.name: name
params.description: a name for the node

LGraphCanvas.name: LGraphCanvas
LGraphCanvas.description: marks as dirty the canvas, this way it will be rendered again

params.name: canvas
params.description: the canvas where you want to render (it accepts a selector in string format or the canvas element itself)

params.name: graph
params.description: [optional]

params.name: options
params.description: [optional] { skip_rendering, autoresize, viewport }

params.name: values
params.description: (allows object { title: "Nice text", callback: function ... })

params.name: options
params.description:
[optional] Some options:\
- title: title to show on top of the menu
- callback: function to call when an option is clicked, it receives the item information
- ignore_item_callbacks: ignores the callback inside the item, it just calls the options.callback
- event: you can pass a MouseEvent, this way the ContextMenu appears in that position

classitems.description: Register a node class so it can be listed when the user wants to create a new one
classitems.name: registerNodeType

params.name: type
params.description: name of the node and path

params.name: base_class
params.description: class containing the structure of a node

classitems.description: removes a node type from the system
classitems.name: unregisterNodeType

params.name: type
params.description: name of the node or the node constructor itself

classitems.description: Save a slot type and his node
classitems.name: registerSlotType

params.name: type
params.description: name of the node or the node constructor itself

params.name: slot_type
params.description: name of the slot type (variable type), eg. string, number, array, boolean, ..

classitems.description:
Create a new nodetype by passing a function, it wraps it with a proper class and generates inputs according to the parameters of the function.
Useful to wrap simple methods that do not require properties, and that only process some input to generate an output.
classitems.name: wrapFunctionAsNode

params.name: name
params.description: node name with namespace (p.e.: 'math/sum')

params.name: param_types
params.description: [optional] an array containing the type of every parameter, otherwise parameters will accept any type

params.name: return_type
params.description: [optional] string with the return type, otherwise it will be generic

params.name: properties
params.description: [optional] properties to be configurable

classitems.description: Removes all previously registered node's types

Adds this method to all nodetypes, existing and to be created
(You can add it to LGraphNode.prototype but then existing node types wont have it)
classitems.name: addNodeMethod

classitems.description: Create a node of a given type with a name. The node is not attached to any graph yet.
classitems.name: createNode

params.name: type
params.description: full name of the node class. p.e. "math/sin"

params.name: name
params.description: a name to distinguish from other nodes

params.name: options
params.description: to set options

classitems.description: Returns a registered node type with a given name
classitems.name: getNodeType

params.name: type
params.description: full name of the node class. p.e. "math/sin"

classitems.description: Returns a list of node types matching one category
classitems.name: getNodeType

params.name: category
params.description: category name

return.description: array with all the node classes

classitems.description: Returns a list with all the node type categories
classitems.name: getNodeTypesCategories

params.name: filter
params.description: only nodes with ctor.filter equal can be shown

return.description: array with all the names of the categories

classitems.description: Returns if the types of two slots are compatible (taking into account wildcards, etc)
classitems.name: isValidConnection

return.description: true if they can be connected

classitems.description: Register a string in the search box so when the user types it it will recommend this node
classitems.name: registerSearchboxExtra

params.name: node_type
params.description: the node recommended

params.name: description
params.description: text to show next to it

params.name: data
params.description: it could contain info of how the node should be configured

return.description: true if they can be connected

classitems.description: Wrapper to load files (from url using fetch or from file using FileReader)
classitems.name: fetchFile

params.name: url
params.description: the url of the file (or the file itself)

params.name: type
params.description: an string to know how to fetch it: "text","arraybuffer","json","blob"

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback(data)

params.name: on_error
params.description: in case of an error

classitems.description: Removes all nodes from this graph
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Attach Canvas to this graph
classitems.name: attachCanvas

classitems.description: Detach Canvas from this graph
classitems.name: detachCanvas

classitems.description: Starts running this graph every interval milliseconds.
classitems.name: start

params.name: interval
params.description: amount of milliseconds between executions, if 0 then it renders to the monitor refresh rate

classitems.description: Stops the execution loop of the graph
classitems.name: stop execution

classitems.description: Run N steps (cycles) of the graph
classitems.name: runStep

params.name: num
params.description: number of steps to run, default is 1

params.name: do_not_catch_errors
params.description: [optional] if you want to try/catch errors

params.name: limit
params.description: max number of nodes to execute (used to execute from start to a node)

classitems.description:
Updates the graph execution order according to relevance of the nodes (nodes with only outputs have more relevance than
nodes with only inputs.
classitems.name: updateExecutionOrder

classitems.description:
Returns all the nodes that could affect this one (ancestors) by crawling all the inputs recursively.
It doesn't include the node itself
classitems.name: getAncestors

return.description: an array with all the LGraphNodes that affect this node, in order of execution

classitems.description: Positions every node in a more readable manner
classitems.name: arrange

classitems.description: Returns the amount of time the graph has been running in milliseconds
classitems.name: getTime

return.description: number of milliseconds the graph has been running

classitems.description: Returns the amount of time accumulated using the fixedtime_lapse var. This is used in context where the time increments should be constant
classitems.name: getFixedTime

return.description: number of milliseconds the graph has been running

classitems.description:
Returns the amount of time it took to compute the latest iteration. Take into account that this number could be not correct
if the nodes are using graphical actions
classitems.name: getElapsedTime

return.description: number of milliseconds it took the last cycle

classitems.description: Sends an event to all the nodes, useful to trigger stuff
classitems.name: sendEventToAllNodes

params.name: eventname
params.description: the name of the event (function to be called)

params.name: params
params.description: parameters in array format

classitems.description: Adds a new node instance to this graph

params.description: the instance of the node

params.description: the instance of the node

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a class
classitems.name: findNodesByClass

params.name: classObject
params.description: the class itself (not an string)

return.description: a list with all the nodes of this type

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a type
classitems.name: findNodesByType

params.name: type
params.description: the name of the node type

return.description: a list with all the nodes of this type

classitems.description: Returns the first node that matches a name in its title

params.description: the name of the node to search

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a name

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the node to search

return.description: a list with all the nodes with this name

classitems.description: Returns the top-most node in this position of the canvas

params.name: x

return.description: the node at this position or null

classitems.description: Returns the top-most group in that position

params.name: x

params.name: y
params.description: the y coordinate in canvas space

classitems.description:
Checks that the node type matches the node type registered, used when replacing a nodetype by a newer version during execution
this replaces the ones using the old version with the new version
classitems.name: checkNodeTypes

classitems.description: Tell this graph it has a global graph input of this type

params.name: value

classitems.description: returns if the graph is in live mode

classitems.description: clears the triggered slot animation in all links (stop visual animation)

classitems.description: Creates a Object containing all the info about this graph, it can be serialized

classitems.description: Configure a graph from a JSON string

params.description: configure a graph from a JSON string

params.name: returns
params.description: if there was any error parsing

classitems.description: configure a node from an object containing the serialized info
classitems.name: configure

classitems.description: serialize the content
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description: serialize and stringify
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: get the title string

classitems.description: sets the value of a property

classitems.name: setOutputData

classitems.description: sets the output data type, useful when you want to be able to overwrite the data type
classitems.name: setOutputDataType

classitems.description: Retrieves the input data (data traveling through the connection) from one slot
classitems.name: getInputData

params.name: force_update
params.description: if set to true it will force the connected node of this slot to output data into this link

return.description: data or if it is not connected returns undefined

classitems.description: Retrieves the input data type (in case this supports multiple input types)
classitems.name: getInputDataType

classitems.description: Retrieves the input data from one slot using its name instead of slot number

params.name: force_update
params.description: if set to true it will force the connected node of this slot to output data into this link

return.description: data or if it is not connected returns null

classitems.description: tells you if there is a connection in one input slot
classitems.name: isInputConnected

classitems.description: tells you info about an input connection (which node, type, etc)
classitems.name: getInputInfo

return.description: object or null { link: id, name: string, type: string or 0 }

classitems.name: getOutputData

classitems.description: tells you info about an output connection (which node, type, etc)
classitems.name: getOutputInfo

return.description: object or null { name: string, type: string, links: [ ids of links in number ] }

classitems.description: tells you if there is a connection in one output slot

classitems.description: tells you if there is any connection in the output slots

classitems.description: retrieves all the nodes connected to this output slot

classitems.description: Triggers the node code execution, place a boolean/counter to mark the node as being executed

classitems.description: Triggers an action, wrapped by logics to control execution flow

params.name: action
params.description: name

classitems.description: Triggers an event in this node, this will trigger any output with the same name

params.name: event

classitems.description: Triggers a slot event in this node: cycle output slots and launch execute/action on connected nodes

params.name: slot
params.description: the index of the output slot

params.name: link_id
params.description: [optional] in case you want to trigger and specific output link in a slot

classitems.description: clears the trigger slot animation

params.name: slot
params.description: the index of the output slot

params.name: link_id
params.description: [optional] in case you want to trigger and specific output link in a slot

classitems.description: changes node size and triggers callback

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the output type ("vec3","number",...)

params.name: extra_info
params.description: this can be used to have special properties of the property (like values, etc)

classitems.description: add a new output slot to use in this node

params.name: type

params.name: array
params.description: of triplets like [[name,type,extra_info],[...]]

classitems.description: remove an existing output slot
classitems.name: removeOutput

classitems.description: add a new input slot to use in this node
classitems.name: addInput

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the input type ("vec3","number",...), it its a generic one use 0

params.name: extra_info
params.description: this can be used to have special properties of an input (label, color, position, etc)

classitems.description: add several new input slots in this node
classitems.name: addInputs

params.name: array
params.description: of triplets like [[name,type,extra_info],[...]]

classitems.description: remove an existing input slot
classitems.name: removeInput

classitems.description: add an special connection to this node (used for special kinds of graphs)
classitems.name: addConnection

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the input type ("vec3","number",...)

params.name: pos
params.description: position of the connection inside the node

params.name: direction
params.description: if is input or output

classitems.description: computes the minimum size of a node according to its inputs and output slots
classitems.name: computeSize

classitems.description: returns all the info available about a property of this node.
classitems.name: getPropertyInfo

params.name: property
params.description: name of the property

return.description: the object with all the available info

classitems.description: Defines a widget inside the node, it will be rendered on top of the node, you can control lots of properties
classitems.name: addWidget

params.name: type
params.description: the widget type (could be "number","string","combo"

params.name: name
params.description: the text to show on the widget

params.name: value
params.description: the default value

params.name: callback
params.description: function to call when it changes (optionally, it can be the name of the property to modify)

params.name: options
params.description: the object that contains special properties of this widget

classitems.description:
returns the bounding of the object, used for rendering purposes
bounding is: [topleft_cornerx, topleft_cornery, width, height]
classitems.name: getBounding

classitems.description: checks if a point is inside the shape of a node
classitems.name: isPointInside

classitems.description: checks if a point is inside a node slot, and returns info about which slot
classitems.name: getSlotInPosition

return.description: if found the object contains { input|output: slot object, slot: number, link_pos: [x,y] }

classitems.description: returns the input slot with a given name (used for dynamic slots), -1 if not found
classitems.name: findInputSlot

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the slot

params.name: returnObj
params.description: if the obj itself wanted

classitems.description: returns the output slot with a given name (used for dynamic slots), -1 if not found
classitems.name: findOutputSlot

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the slot

params.name: returnObj
params.description: if the obj itself wanted

classitems.description: returns the first free input slot
classitems.name: findInputSlotFree

classitems.description: returns the first output slot free
classitems.name: findOutputSlotFree

classitems.description: findSlotByType for INPUTS
findSlotByType for OUTPUTS
returns the output (or input) slot with a given type, -1 if not found
classitems.name: findSlotByType

params.name: input
params.description: uise inputs instead of outputs

params.name: type
params.description: the type of the slot

params.name: returnObj
params.description: if the obj itself wanted

params.name: preferFreeSlot
params.description: if we want a free slot (if not found, will return the first of the type anyway)

classitems.description: connect this node output to the input of another node BY TYPE
classitems.name: connectByType

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: node
params.description: the target node

params.name: target_type
params.description: the input slot type of the target node

return.description: the link_info is created, otherwise null

classitems.description: connect this node input to the output of another node BY TYPE
classitems.name: connectByType

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: node
params.description: the target node

params.name: target_type
params.description: the output slot type of the target node

return.description: the link_info is created, otherwise null

classitems.description: connect this node output to the input of another node
classitems.name: connect

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: node
params.description: the target node

params.name: target_slot
params.description: the input slot of the target node (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot, or -1 to connect a trigger)

return.description: the link_info is created, otherwise null

classitems.description: disconnect one output to an specific node
classitems.name: disconnectOutput

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: target_node
params.description: the target node to which this slot is connected [Optional, if not target_node is specified all nodes will be disconnected]

classitems.description: disconnect one input
classitems.name: disconnectInput

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

classitems.description: returns the center of a connection point in canvas coords
classitems.name: getConnectionPos

params.name: is_input
params.description: true if if a input slot, false if it is an output

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: out
params.description: [optional] a place to store the output, to free garbage

classitems.description: Collapse the node to make it smaller on the canvas
classitems.name: collapse

classitems.description: Forces the node to do not move or realign on Z
classitems.name: pin

classitems.description: clears all the data inside
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: assigns a graph, you can reassign graphs to the same canvas
classitems.name: setGraph

classitems.description: returns the top level graph (in case there are subgraphs open on the canvas)
classitems.name: getTopGraph

classitems.description: opens a graph contained inside a node in the current graph
classitems.name: openSubgraph

classitems.description: closes a subgraph contained inside a node
classitems.name: closeSubgraph

params.name: assigns
params.description: a graph

classitems.description: returns the visually active graph (in case there are more in the stack)
classitems.name: getCurrentGraph

classitems.description: assigns a canvas
classitems.name: setCanvas

params.name: assigns
params.description: a canvas (also accepts the ID of the element (not a selector)

classitems.description: binds mouse, keyboard, touch and drag events to the canvas
classitems.name: bindEvents

classitems.description: unbinds mouse events from the canvas
classitems.name: unbindEvents

classitems.description:
this function allows to render the canvas using WebGL instead of Canvas2D
this is useful if you plant to render 3D objects inside your nodes, it uses litegl.js for webgl and canvas2DtoWebGL to emulate the Canvas2D calls in webGL
classitems.name: enableWebGL

classitems.description: Used to attach the canvas in a popup
classitems.name: getCanvasWindow

return.description: returns the window where the canvas is attached (the DOM root node)

classitems.description: starts rendering the content of the canvas when needed
classitems.name: startRendering

classitems.description: stops rendering the content of the canvas (to save resources)
classitems.name: stopRendering

classitems.description:
Don't call the function if the block is already selected.
Otherwise, it could cause the block to be unselected while its panel is open.
Called when a mouse move event has to be processed
classitems.name: processMouseMove

classitems.description: Called when a mouse up event has to be processed
classitems.name: processMouseUp

classitems.description: Called when a mouse wheel event has to be processed
classitems.name: processMouseWheel

classitems.description: returns true if a position (in graph space) is on top of a node little corner box
classitems.name: isOverNodeBox

classitems.description: returns the INDEX if a position (in graph space) is on top of a node input slot
classitems.name: isOverNodeInput

classitems.description: returns the INDEX if a position (in graph space) is on top of a node output slot
classitems.name: isOverNodeOuput

classitems.description: process a key event
classitems.name: processKey

classitems.description: process a item drop event on top the canvas
classitems.name: processDrop

classitems.description: selects a given node (or adds it to the current selection)
classitems.name: selectNode

classitems.description: selects several nodes (or adds them to the current selection)
classitems.name: selectNodes

classitems.description: removes a node from the current selection
classitems.name: deselectNode

classitems.description: removes all nodes from the current selection
classitems.name: deselectAllNodes

classitems.description: deletes all nodes in the current selection from the graph
classitems.name: deleteSelectedNodes

classitems.description: centers the camera on a given node
classitems.name: centerOnNode

classitems.description: adds some useful properties to a mouse event, like the position in graph coordinates
classitems.name: adjustMouseEvent

classitems.description: changes the zoom level of the graph (default is 1), you can pass also a place used to pivot the zoom
classitems.name: setZoom

classitems.description: converts a coordinate from graph coordinates to canvas2D coordinates
classitems.name: convertOffsetToCanvas

classitems.description: converts a coordinate from Canvas2D coordinates to graph space
classitems.name: convertCanvasToOffset

classitems.description: brings a node to front (above all other nodes)
classitems.name: bringToFront

classitems.description: sends a node to the back (below all other nodes)
classitems.name: sendToBack

classitems.description: checks which nodes are visible (inside the camera area)
classitems.name: computeVisibleNodes

classitems.description: renders the whole canvas content, by rendering in two separated canvas, one containing the background grid and the connections, and one containing the nodes)
classitems.name: draw

classitems.description: draws the front canvas (the one containing all the nodes)
classitems.name: drawFrontCanvas

classitems.description: draws the panel in the corner that shows subgraph properties
classitems.name: drawSubgraphPanel

classitems.description: draws some useful stats in the corner of the canvas
classitems.name: renderInfo

classitems.description: draws the back canvas (the one containing the background and the connections)
classitems.name: drawBackCanvas

classitems.description: draws the given node inside the canvas
classitems.name: drawNode

classitems.description: draws the shape of the given node in the canvas
classitems.name: drawNodeShape

classitems.description:
draws every connection visible in the canvas
OPTIMIZE THIS: pre-catch connections position instead of recomputing them every time
classitems.name: drawConnections

classitems.description: draws a link between two points
classitems.name: renderLink

params.name: a
params.description: start pos

params.name: b
params.description: end pos

params.name: link
params.description: the link object with all the link info

params.name: skip_border
params.description: ignore the shadow of the link

params.name: flow
params.description: show flow animation (for events)

params.name: color
params.description: the color for the link

params.name: start_dir
params.description: the direction enum

params.name: end_dir
params.description: the direction enum

params.name: num_sublines
params.description: number of sublines (useful to represent vec3 or rgb)

classitems.description: draws the widgets stored inside a node
classitems.name: drawNodeWidgets

classitems.description: process an event on widgets
classitems.name: processNodeWidgets

classitems.description: draws every group area in the background
classitems.name: drawGroups

classitems.description: resizes the canvas to a given size, if no size is passed, then it tries to fill the parentNode
classitems.name: resize

classitems.description:
switches to live mode (node shapes are not rendered, only the content)
this feature was designed when graphs where meant to create user interfaces
classitems.name: switchLiveMode

Missing item type
Removes all previously registered node's types

Don't call the function if the block is already selected.
Otherwise, it could cause the block to be unselected while its panel is open.
